Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Travellers”
Reviews.Author: RupeshM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the airport. The nearest metro station (green Line) is Deira City Center which is less than 5 mins walking. Rooms and bathroom are very compact. Rooms are clean and are designed keeping needs of business travelers. If you are a tourist, and you are going to be out through out the day, this hotel is good value for money. Lobby is very small and was always full. We had breakfast, but the service was poor. Staff is neither rude nor courteous. Deira City Center Shopping mall is bang opposite to the hotel, The mall is good for shopping and for food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay..no frill experience”
Reviews.Author: PD014
Reviews.Content: Its a good place for budget stay. Clean and tidy..do not expect big size rooms. But rooms r comfortable. Breakfast was ok nothing great. Location is really a big plus. close to mall and metro station. Due to to the mall, getting a taxi was't an issue. overall value for money

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: margarets508
Reviews.Content: Having had a long journey from Auckland and arriving at 8.00am we were picked at the airport without any problem and arrived to a welcome from the Reception Desk. The Receptionists had a smile to greet us and apologised that we had to wait for our room. We went for a walk to the excellent Mall opposite and on our return we only had to wait a short while before we were told our room was ready. There is free internet and a free bus to Jameira Beach park- to which we used both. The full breakfast was great and for 2 days we felt very relaxed and comfortable. We would certainly stay there again on our way to places far. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located property in the main area”
Reviews.Author: Aneesh2011
Reviews.Content: Another standard Ibis property in Dubai. The key being the location - proximity to public transport, airport, the Diera City Center Mall and the neighboring places - where one goes normally in Dubai. Otherwise, average service that gives a near VFM returns.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: SerdarPolat
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception wouldnt even acknowledge the problem. Noone tried to help or interest. Escipicaly the staff at reception (named Mohammed) answered my request like an enemy. Also same guy was laughing after me and some quests with unacceptable words. I know Urdu. I will never go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget hotel near the city center mall”
Reviews.Author: Helal1
Reviews.Content: Two star hotel is neat the city center mall. It takes about 5 min walk to the metro station. The rooms are small and basic but clean. There is no safety box in the rooms. Internet is free in the lobby. The service is great, and that makes the difference. Sure I will come back if I am looking for budget and clean accommodation in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ISMLYLMZ
Reviews.Content: This was my third time and surely won't be again. Value was terribly inappropriate, breakfast was totally poor compares with its price! Nothing in the room and everything is money in this hotel such as breakfast, wi-fi etc... To sum up it does not worth to stay.

Reviews.Title: “handy”
Reviews.Author: englishmanaway
Reviews.Content: close to everythink very central nice room clean good aircon tv bathroom no mini bar but staff very helpful about putting my insulin in there kitchen fridge makes a hotel helpful staff going that bit extra breakfast good buffet but a bit to busy at o800 hrs best to sit outside after the bun fight ! handy for the airport and a mall opersite comfy bed with extra pillow if neaded we were right by the lifts but no noise at all our room overlooked a park and every few mins a plane could be sean taking off ,on noise tho enjoyable stop a bit expensive but it is dubai isnt it

Reviews.Title: “Very impersonal”
Reviews.Author: tug568wil
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night to make a flight connection on our return journey home. The location of the hotel was good, very close to the airport and the city centre, so as a transit type hotel it was probably okay. We arrived early in the morning, tired after a very early start and fairly long flight. The hotel was very busy and we were informed that our room wasn't ready and we had to wait probably 3-4 hours. The reception staff were not friendly or particularly helpful and we were asked to take a seat in the reception area, which was by this time getting busier and not particularly comfortable. we did eventually get our room which was very basic, but functional. We neeeded to leave early the folllowing morning and were told that we would be able to get a limited breakfast that had been paid for from the small cafe bar in reception, however when we got down stairs, it appeared that htis was not the case and we left without anything to eat or drink

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nahdiah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two and it was excellent situated directly opposite the mall and near to the rail station so getting around was not a problem. The staff at the hotel were warm friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and super clean . The resturant was excellent and wifi in the lobby free . Overall a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ChipPan
Reviews.Content: The building seems fairly new (to be fair, as are many buildings in Dubai) and was in a good location. Stayed here for one night and it is a fairly good standard of decor, cleanliness and service. Wi-Fi only was free/available in the lobby but this worked fine. No breakfast included in the standard room. Happy with the room and no major quibbles - nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with low human touch service”
Reviews.Author: HU C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really not much to talk about . It is just a standard hotel but the only that people at reception are not friendly and always pretending that they are busy. Also I did not like the attitude one of them , I do not remember her name, She is Philippine maybe Sare. Anyway I do not recommend to stay there for more than one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: leashieloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here. It is reasonably priced , rooms are clean and adequate. So close to mall and metro.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel pricewise for a short stay only and dubai sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right opposite the Deira City Centre Shopping mall, which has a good food court if you need to eat inexpensively and a wide variety of Shopping. The bedroom was adequate with very limited wardrobes and not much draw space but OK for a few days. Bathroom tight but good. You should ask for rooms with a view over the creek (preferrably a high floor) which have an iconic vista of the high rise towers. Breakfast was a quite creditable buffet selection european style. You cannot use the lifts in the upwards direction without your room key and this is a good security feature. The Internet is free with just 3 terminals in the Reception Lobby and the Reception staff were outstanding throughout helping the visitors with a whole range of matters outside the hotel as well as inside. I knew that local phone calls were free to the population so whenever I needed the local rep of the travel agency I booked through, I just asked to call FOC from the reception desk which the staff were willing to do provided I kept the calls short. Our son used the bar extensively and once left his valuables there, which the staff honestly retrieved and kept safe until his return. Hotels are allowed, under licence, to serve alcohol but you will not find it easily elsewhere so bring your duty free. Taxis are available from outside and are supposedly inexpensive but ensure they turn the meter on. Now going into the historic centre by car is dire so plan your trip to the souks. Our driver got to know us over 2 days and we found the best deal is to pay by the hour (includes waiting time) when you know exactly where you want to go. You need to purchase/obtain a tourist map beforehand. We purchased somali frankincense and Myrrh in the spice market but go in a little way and the stalls become cheaper. The Gold souk boasts a corner shop with the largest gold ring in the world. it looked to be 30 inches in diameter and 15 inches long. Really bad traffic to get to it but difficult to get lost in the souks if you stay to the main malls. Easy walking distance of the abras (water ferries) which at 1 Dirham are a great photo opportunity. Back to the hotel. Go to the swimming pool in afternoon which has a 30 dirham charge in the internally connected adjoining Novotel. However if you buy a poolside drink then the 30 dirham charge is waived. Best to go in the afternoon say after 3pm when the sun has hit the water and warmed the pool. Clean toilets here and secure locker in the changing room all free of charge. Despite only being at 1st floor level the pool is shielded from traffic noise which can be significant outside the hotel. The Metro system is just 5 minutes walk away but remember Friday being the holy day is does not start until afternoon that day. We asked to check out late on one of the rooms the family took and paid a very reasonable 177 dirhams to use in until 6pm. Mind you the late checkout was negotiated on arrival so do not leave it until the last day, when the allocation might be gone. You need a room key each and we always left one key inserted in the room so we always came back to a cool room. It was 28+ degrees outside and this in january!Another perk of asking for a Creek View is you avoid direct sunlight into the rooms in the afternoon. Turn left out of the hotel and walk about 300 metres and you will find a beautiful airconditioned patisserie which looked good but we did not use. Go halfway back to the hotel and in a backstreet is a mosque which westerners cannot enter but go near sunset and see the worship hall all lit up and look at the chandelier. One of the biggest I have ever seen. I will not tell you what it looks like even from outside as that will be your treat. The Deira City Centre shopping mall has an information point where you can collect a shopping centre plan of all the units. We noted the price of Ipads were the same in Jacky's, Virgin Media and one other shop, it might be called D & J or something like that. It gets so hot only the tourist walk outdoors so similar to parts of Los Angeles but you must sightsee the beach area but if you have children and want a beach holiday this is not the hotel for you. One final perk of the location of this hotel. Apparently The Big Bus tours (open topped double deckers) leave from somewhere in the adjoining Deira City Centre shopping mall. We never used it because we had booked a full city sightseeing tour through our travel agent. Chris, Anna & Jordan

Reviews.Title: “4D stay at the IBIS Deira”
Reviews.Author: NareshShanbhag
Reviews.Content: Basic & functional hotel. Very conveniently located for me as a tourist. Deira City center Mall located right opposite the hotel. Starting point for the Hop-on, Hop-off bus service also starting out from this mall. A large Carrefour outlet for any sundries shopping besides having the mall with all the leading brand outlets.Food options in the hotel are limited but good enough. Breakfast was wholesome though the menu was repetitive. Overall good experience and would definitely recommend for the budget tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: springerronald
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few due to flight delays. Decent hotel for a short stopover. Easy check-in, nice friendly staff, clean comfortable room.. Enjoyed to happy hour at the bar and the live football that's shown each day.. Free Internet use.. Great.. No complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Good location near the Metro and Mall”
Reviews.Author: almoe07
Reviews.Content: The big mall for shopping was right accross from the Hotel and the Metro SUBWAY was not very far.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business and vacation travelers.”
Reviews.Author: Godfrey S
Reviews.Content: Ibis Deira city centre is well located,not as crowded as the down town hotels.its clean,the breakfast is fantastic. Its near the Airport and opposite Deira city centre shopping mall.its just few munites by Taxi or Metro to down town Deira. Room Internet is quite expensive costing 25aed per hour but the hotel has free wifi in the lobby. I advise anyone intending to stay at ibis to book online cse it's cheap than booking from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Josh R
Reviews.Content: First imprsseions of Hotel were that it was clean and tidy, The room was fine Although no fridge. and well located (close to mall, train and Airport). However our experience there was very dissapointing. Things that are usually free or have a nominal cost were a fortune 30durhams for a swim, wifi only in reception. Breakfast consisted of some beans, sasuages and powdered scrambled eggs. Reception staff booked us our desert safari tour and failed to confirm (we paid) And spent nearly 2 hours at reception waiting for a tour which never showed. To top this off we had an early flight and when we got up our bathroom had no hot water, On contacting reception we were informed there was nothing they could do.(so much for there 15minute guarentee). Overall if I was going back to Dubai I wont be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the overall stay was ok. however, i have 2 main comments. the first comment, there is no mini bar/fridge in the room, although an ice make is available at the first floor, but it's not convenient especially for families with infants. second comment, there's no room service at all and you have to go down to restaurants and get your order by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms Need Improvement”
Reviews.Author: hkg2009hkg
Reviews.Content: Great location just a few minutes from the metro station, being only a 5-minute ride to the airport and 10 minutes into the old town. Mall across the street with a huge Carrefour but there's no fridge in the room, which appears to be typical of all ibis hotels worldwide. Water pressure in the shower is not enough, and since it's not a bathtub setting, the water can easily overflow out of the shower area and flood the bathroom. Checkout was also on the slow side since I had already prepaid my stay upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alet F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ibis Deira City Centre Hotel for three nights in December 2011. I think the hotel is good value for money. We found the staff at reception to be very friendly. We arrived early morning and could leave our luggage at the hotel until a later check-in. Wi-fi in the lobby is free and there are also three PCs in the lobby that guests can use in case they don't have their own laptops. The room was quite small as well as the bed and bathroom. As other guests have mentioned, there are no coffee/tea-making facilities in the rooms. There are also no safe in the rooms. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are very clean. We found breakfast to be sufficient for our needs and good value for the price. And the location of the hotel is very good. being opposite Deira City Centre - a great mall with excellent shops that stay open until late at night. It was very easy to catch a taxi in front of the hotel. The hotel is VERY close to a metro station. We mostly travelled by taxi but I think the location of the metro station is very convenient for travellers staying at the Ibis. All in all I think this hotel is good value for money and we enjoyed the modern look of the hotel, especially the lobby and dining area. If we ever travelled back to Dubai, we would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: rajhemworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011. Found some of the Staff at front office very rude and not welcoming at all, their room key cards dont work sometimes and have to be charged again at front office. Rooms are OK without tea coffee making facilities, internet in room is chargeable, in lobby it is free. Breakfast is OK , but not as good as some other IBIS hotels, not much variety at all. Overall for the kind of rates they charge not too great.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Ibis Deira City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a regular to this hotel. Convenient to the City Centre shopping mall and quick access to taxis any time of day or night. A short ride to Dubai airport. This Ibis is designed much the same as European Ibis hotels. Comfortable bed and good working desk area. Clean wet room shower area with decent water pressure The hotel can be very busy being popular with tourists. Free wifi access in lobby, room access is very expensive at 100AED for 12 hours which is one area in need of improvement. But overall, a consistently reliable hotel and one I will continue to use in the future

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: NongMi
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. The location of this place is great, very close to metro and is just right in front of shopping mall. The hotel itself is very clean. Staff are friendly. As it is budget hotel, there is no fridge and drinking water in the room but they have vendor machine on each floor (at market price) which make it very easy.

Reviews.Title: “location, room, clean, cozy lobby, tv program”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at this hotel. We like this hotel because of it great location with near access to train station. The Deira city center (shopping center) just walk a few meters only. The clean of hotel overall are very healthy. The room is not big enough if you stay with 2 children, but we like the room interiors which are sleek and modern, but the water pressure in our room was not good enough to give us a good shower. The lobby are very cozy environment which you can relax yourself after a long day out with their comfy sofa and free wifi. I've enjoy watching the tv channel program, but should do more better if included sport channel like ESPN/Star sport to cater some live European football match.

Reviews.Title: “good &clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Majid F
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for more than two weeks,It was a good experience the hotel`s position is very good It was very close to metro station and shopping center.The hotel was clean but a little small and the biggest problem of the rooms was their windows, that you cannot open them.But we think it would be okay for 2 or3 days stay.And about the food I should say That we just had breakfast which was rather good but i think it`d be better if it had more variety. our overall experience at this hotel was good .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Near Airport, Shopping Mall”
Reviews.Author: LeeKH
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Ibis hotels I have stayed at. I have been to so many of them across Europe. This one at Deira City is second to none. The check in and check out were very smooth and quick. The staff who checked me in was polite and informative. The room and the bed were comfortable. This trip to the UAE I stayed at Ibis, Mercure, and Pullman because I wanted to compare them. All in all, the stay at this Ibis was very positive and definitely worth the amount I spent. Remember that this is a decent basic hotel. If you want extra facilities, the Novotel is just next door a few meters away. In fact, I had my breakfast at the Novotel because I am a big fan of the Novotel buffet. I stayed at the Ibis because my flight arrived at the Dubai Airport at night and I did not want any facilities other than a decent place to sleep. I would continue to Abu Dhabi next morning. I used the Metro from Airport Terminal 1 and the Deira City Centre was just 2 stations away (cost me 4Dhrs). The hotel is just 300 meters from the metro across the street. The Deira City Centre Mall is huge and there is a Carrefour Supermarket there.

Reviews.Title: “Reqt Improvements”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay was comfortable,but I have some suggestionsfor to make rooms more comfortable. A electrical kettle with facilities to make Tea/Coffee should be provided bcse it is not possible to go down early morning for a cup of Tea.Shower room should have sliding door so that water while taking shower should spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel IBIS ,Dubai review”
Reviews.Author: Jayadasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the Dubai airport - But the facilities inside the room are not good. We have to get water by dropping coins in the automatic vending machines in each floor. Coffee is not available in the rooms. The internet charges are 75 dhirams for 12 hours but if you close your computer for going outside and restarting, you are doubly charged.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great if you're out most of the time”
Reviews.Author: mrspink
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 4 night/3 day stopover and found it great value for money. It's in a good location opposite a shopping mall with a huge carrefour supermarket. The metro station is just a couple of mins walk. Wherever you stay in Dubai you'd have to travel to see the sights so it suited our needs. The rooms are small but were clean and modern and had good air conditioning. The beds are hard, that's the only complaint. Dubai is very spread out and we were out all day so never even made use of the pool next door (small charge) as we only returned to our room late evening. We got a taxi to the arabian courtyard (about 15 aed) to visit the pub there as didn't find the bar area that inviting and the Sherlock Holmes pub had a good atmosphere aswell as being cheaper. The hotel only took 5 mins from the airport by a taxi (35 aed). I was glad we hadn't spent a lot more money on a plush hotel when we out and about all the time but if you're in Dubai for longer or just plan on relaxing then I'd opt for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “traveler”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I did not expect more it was bussy period due to big 5 show there was not enough staff to coop with this. I had better service before and better breakfast. I doo not understand why should I comment 200 caracters minimum

Reviews.Title: “Best Ibis in UAE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Ibis feels like a home from home. Good parking underneath the hotel. Good customer service and efficient reception. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was disappointing on this visit. If all you want is a bed for the night, this is the place to stay. I love the bathrooms in particular. The features must have been designed by a woman, because everything is where you want it to be.

Reviews.Title: “The room are soo small !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my collegue stayed the Ibis Deira Ctiy center Hotel. The room was very small, we could nt move . Second things, we arrived at 05 .30 to hotel. We excepting to get room around 10 - 12 but they did nt give us untill 14 00. I think , flexible working arrangement will be perfect for the costumer who has nt sleep whoole night.

Reviews.Title: “Third-World Goons At The Door, Paper Thin Walls, Broken Ice Machines, Pathetic Internet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No one ever stays at an Ibis expecting very much, but this place failed to live up to even my worst expectations. The walls were so thin I could hear every noise my neighbours made, including when their mobile phones went off in the morning to wake them up. I would return back to the hotel only to find one of the two ice machines available to guests permanently broken and the other one usually empty. The promise of "we solve your problem in 15 minutes or you are our guest" is bollocks. I never had anything solved in 15 minutes of the problems I had with the room, and usually I would ring back a 2nd or 3rd time when someone stupidly told me "oh, you mean no one has been to your room yet?" A friend of mine from the Philippines came to see me several nights in a row. One night she was very upset because her son back home was very ill and she was so emotional that she forgot to bring her passport with her. The third-world goons at the door would not let her upstairs to see me and were as insulting and rude as can be. Then, to top it all off, the free internet in the lobby is as bad as you could imagine it would be. I will never stay in this pigpen full of even piggier managers ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value your money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Modern, Clean and Tidy the rooms are comfortable but furnishings are sparse in keeping with the star rating. There is a huge shopping mall across the road with lots of nearby restaurants. The Bistro Restaurant in the hotel has a fairly standard French menu. Food is well cooked and presented in typical French style. The daily specials are excellent value. Overall value for money this must be the best deal in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This time i had a very bad experience while i am checking-in, it took me 40 minutes to checked in , the signe board was there (priority for A club) but no body was there. My suggestion is to keep one of your staff in that desk.

Reviews.Title: “A true value for money”
Reviews.Author: CASTLEKUWAIT
Reviews.Content: As i have got down from my taxi in front of the hotel tell you frankly i did not expect anything extra ordinary for this hotel.it was nothing but a normal hotel until i took my keys from the hotel receptionist who gave me a swivel card as key to enter to my room. And honestly let me express that this was the first time i have booked a hotel with these kinds of facilities which is also good to maintain your privacy. And hotel restaurant provided us wth a breakfast which was full of all what you need to make your day start dashingly. I enjoyed my stay at ibis deira city centre so much that i wont hesitate to come back again and i would recomend to my friend also. Thanks and Best Rgds, Munir M. Koya Kuwait

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff but good hotel for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: nomadBangalore
Reviews.Content: Location is good and is next door to the Novotel but the service at the front desk is no good. The staff are pretty curt and don't even smile and there is no concierge service available which means you carry your own bags to the room. The rooms are pretty small and this hotel is for the budget conscious traveller. The location is across the road from the City Centre Mall and is close to the Metro station too. The rooms are clean and are neatly maintained. A call for the air conditioning complaint was resolved within 15 minutes so they attend to you pretty quickly. Bathrooms are also small and internet is free in the lobby. They have a decent coffee shop in the lobby area and taxis are easy to find since it is located on the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Service standard and human touch”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Customer Service is not up the usual standard. Guests are not being advised properly and greeted. Room and location are good, but guests for leisure will be rather disappointed when service standard is not being provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Okonom
Reviews.Content: I was very surpriced by the service and the room at this hotel. I did not have high expertations after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor. I was not at all disapointed...... It is a 2star hotel, and that is what you pay for.... Some of the reviews in here are unfair! - Perfect location near a shopping center - The resturant in this hotel and the hotel next door are great. - Free internet in the lobby, bring your own computer or use one of the 3 computers in the lobby. - Clean rooms, really great service. - Polite and service minded staff - Icecube maschine at the first floor - Nice breakfast - Free shuttlebus for the beach I went on vaccation with my family for a week, all six persons had a really nice time. We will for sure come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, right across the road from deira city centre and only 5 min taxi to/from the airport (we stayed because we had a 6am departing flight). It had typical ibis facilities like anywhere in the world, however the bed in our room was very hard and uncomfortable. The floor would have been softer.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: RBM141011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2011 as part of a multi centre holiday. We had a room on the top floor (9th floor), the room was fine and more than good enough to sleep in after a busy day in Duabi. The hotel is directly opposite the Deira City Centre Mall, but other than that, there really isn't much else (for a tourist). For us it required a taxi ride to the various tourist locations, although there is a metro station next to the mall. Trying to get a taxi in the evening on a weekend is a nightmare, hotel could not book one for us and we had to stand in the street and hope one would stop. Breaskfast was ok, reasonable choices of cooked and a good way to start the day. Free Wifi in the lobby was a bonus! Basically a good place to put your head after a busy day. Bit far out from the tourist bits, but then its cheaper for that reason. All in all a comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights while having a quick look around Dubai. The room was good, staff friendly although didn't always have a good grasp of English (maybe we should have learnt Arabic?!). Breakfast was nice enough although I wasn't too keen on the cooked choices. Location's not great if you've only got a few days as most things seem to be near the beach or the Dubai mall. Handy for the airport though as only a couple of stops on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean hotel with good location and porximity to dubai metro.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: its good, no frills hotel. its clean and tidy and basic. But, for this price i would expect more services...atleast room service should be there and a bell boy to pick up your luggage. its okay if someone has a single bag...but we had like 3 big bags and no one came to help. i understand that its a budget hotel...but the prices i paid were not so budget and after all its a hotel and not a service apartment. If, i have to do everything by myself then i am better of in an service apartment which has a lot more facilities. my recommendations:- room service for atleast tea/coffee in morning bell boy for people with more than 2 bags. Electric kettle in rooms i would not recommend this hotel for the price i paid in dubai. yes, for 30% less...i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: jaymes999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights whilst on a sight seeing holiday in Dubai. The hotel rooms are clean and well maintained. Breakfast is decent, good variety of dishes though not a big room and it can be a little frantic! This is in a poor location unless your stay centres around the Deira district. Reception staff were not very helpful or interested. Getting a cab can be a little haphazard. Fine for a quick stop for shopping or if on business.

Reviews.Title: “ideal city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: regosal
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent sized rooms, handy for the airport, nice bar/restaurant area, good breakfast, staff helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Bad concept for hotel name”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Starting from no one to help with luggage to door less wardrobe in a smoking room, you have to go to reception to pay for internet which didn't work in the room, get dressed to go down to 1st floor to get some Ice, pay for breakfast before you eat which was very expensive for the choice available & worst of waiting for the water drops to have a shower, I will never go near any Ibis so called hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachael H
Reviews.Content: Good location- regular taxis and right next to a metro station with metros every 10 mins or so. Not far from airport by taxi or metro. Hotel lobby clean and spacious and room was bigger than photos suggested. Very well presented overall. We didn't buy the breakfast as we thought it was too expensive so we ate supermarket food on the go. Hotel staff were ok at answering questions and pointing out things on a map and tried their best. However weren't greatly helpful for tourists as we got the feeling this was more of a business hotel. Our main problem with this hotel regarded the luggage storage. They were very willing to accomodate your luggage all day but security for the facility was lax at best. There was no help storing luggage and we were left unattended with all the luggage for long periods of time. They also did not check the tickets when we went to collect the luggage and we could've taken any item in there. It was a wonderful hotel for a couple of days with the sights easily reachable by metro or taxi. However possibly not the best place for a long stay. Would definitely go again for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mshakeel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed many time in the Ibis while traveling in Europe. I rate this hotel among the best because of the location, cleanliness, reasonable size room, low price, free wifi in the lobby, nice bar and restaurant. However, breakfast was slightly disappointing. If you are looking for cheap, no frill clean accommodation for short stay this place is among the best in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: mezperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night as a stopover on the way from rome to perth. Arrived at 5am to find out there had been a mix up with our booking due to time differences, flights etc and the early check in we had so carefully arranged was not available! However the reception staff were very pleasant about it and offered to look after our bags until 2pm while we went out and about, or pay about AUD $40 to check in immediately. We chose to check in immediately. Twin room was adequate in size, flat screen TV with a few channels to choose from. We had breakfast included in our rate - I found it to be pretty average. Shower leaked onto the bathroom floor. The location is great, only 5 min from the airport and across the road from Deira City Centre, which I found to be a great shopping centre. You can take the metro to the Dubai Mall, which is amazing. We loved Dubai and will stopover here again, but might pay a little more next time for a hotel with a bit more luxury and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Foocumchu
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner to Dubai and stayed at the ‘Ibis Deira City Hotel for 3 nights on the 20th September. The hotel is located around 10 minutes’ drive from the airport, we did have a transfer booked through the tour operator, however they were plenty of taxis outside the airport which are easy to find and are well sign posted. Taxis are very reasonable and cost only a few pounds for that distance. Dubai is split in to 2 main areas ‘Deria’ and ‘Jumira’ divided down the centre by Dubai Creek. The hotel is located in the old city ‘Deria’ which is just outside of the centre of Dubai but within a short travel distance to all the main attractions via the tube system which is located about a 5 minute walk to the right of the hotel and runs in a straight line and is very easy to use ‘Jebal Ali’ will take you to wards the city and ‘Rashyda’ will take you back towards Deira, it is very cheap and you need to buy a day travel card from the ticket booth not the machines (ask for the red ones the blue are 2 day cards). Check in at the hotel is at 12 noon, be aware that this is fixed and they do not allocate rooms until this time – we arrived at 10am and was advised to go for a walk until our check in time. There is a locked baggage area to leave your bags if you do arrive early, and directly across from the hotel is ‘Deria City Mall’ which is a large shopping centre and a good escape from the heat. There is plenty of seating in the reception area with a drinks bar and free wireless service plus fully air-conditioned which is well needed. We stayed in a twin standard room on a Bed & Breakfast basis, the room was as expected from a Ibis hotel – clean basic but comfortable with full air-conditioning. There is a flat screen TV with some sky channels, the bathroom is small but well equipped and has the added bonus of toiletries. The view from the hotel is of the city and the mall, to be honest unless you choose a beach location at the ‘Jumira’ side of Dubai then this is the view you can expect from any hotel room and is not a negative in anyway. The breakfast is served in the restaurant on the ground floor and is served from 0630-1000, this is a buffet style service and has a really good selection of hot and cold items everything from the usual continental style fruit, pastries and meats to a full English. The hotel is situated next to the ‘Novotel’ and you will have free use of their restaurant in the evening s or the bistro in the ‘Ibis’ both restaurants serve a similar Italian menu – prices are no different to what you would pay in the UK. Tipping is customary for good service, around a couple of Dirims. Other than the usual chain restaurants in the Mall across from the hotel, there is a Turkish restaurant next door to the hotel, although it only takes around 20 minutes to Dubai Mall on the tube and you will find a great selection of restaurants in and around their and the ‘Burj tower’. We were informed that there is a pool and terrace bar at the Novotel of which for 30 Dirims you can use which is around £5.50, although we never felt the need. Tip – It’s worth noting that at the far side of ‘Dubai City Mall’ is the start point for the tour bus, which we found to be a fantastic way of visiting all the major attractions – they run a hop on hop off service and you can buy a 24 or 48 hour ticket which includes entry in to many of the major attractions, the bus stops everywhere it even takes you to Jumira Palm, where it stops at Atlantis. They also run a nonstop night service with a tour guide commentary (Air-conditioned and free water) the buses run every 30 min’s up until late. Defiantly one to visit is the fountains under the ‘Burj Tower’ outside the Dubai Mall, from 1800 there is a light and water display from the fountains which is amazing to watch and runs every 20 minutes. If you have any questions feel free to send me a message I’d be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: AC in the Room was not functioning well. Call to the recepiton was not taken inspite of several attempts from Room. Free Internet connection was not available in the Room. Since internet facility is so cheap internationally unlike before, and it is one of the essential in the present way of life and most of the Hotels are providing the same without any charge, this should be provided free. Breakfast, was not having much options.

Reviews.Title: “i will never stay again”
Reviews.Author: koookyEgypt
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from dubai i stayed there in IBIS DEIRA CITY CENTER there was nothing except location anything else is terrible the receiption staff are rude nobody is willing to help you or even to answer you really it was bad experience do not try to try it the breakfast is very poor according to the value of money really it is abad hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good: Location, Bad: Everything else”
Reviews.Author: jeffinj
Reviews.Content: Cramped up room, no refridgerator, no safe, rude receptionists (except for one person) over counter and over phone. Very expensive snack bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: JakJim1967
Reviews.Content: At AED 250 it was very good value for money Quiet , clean and a good location for the airport and Dubai Metro

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel But not so good”
Reviews.Author: harpreetjagdev
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in other IBIS hotels in UAE and other wise, however this was not so good experience. It was during the EID holidays that I and My parents stayed there. Though I had specifically booked Non Smoking room, The counter person asked me if we'd take a smoking room, I told him, we booked non smoking, i still got a smoking room. He didn't even explain why he did that probably he didn't understand. Secondly, normally for the same price a complementary breakfast is included, however that hotel refused for the same. Thirdly the A/C was not working in my room, I called maintenance, they fixed some valve which was off, which should have been on in the first place. They Said it will take 15 minutes to fix, however it didn't get fixed. it was already too late so we managed somehow. Rooms, Gallery and lobby were very neat and clean, however due to being a smoking room ,my room had a strong Smoke Staunch Finding a parking was a little difficult there. Staff was courteous.. didn't have any food so cannot comment about the same.

Reviews.Title: “No advantage for platinum accord members”
Reviews.Author: Olivier S
Reviews.Content: Just arrived early morning and unfortunately no room is available which happens. As regards internet in the room, it's a cable and you have to pay for it. I asked as a platinum members if there is a advantage or something as this regards as I never pay internet in the room when I go to IBIS. The Management say no. Meaning if you're a frequent flyer and hold a card don't expect any advantage even if you're a platinum member... disapointing and don't think to book again in this hotel. Now I am waiting in the loobys to get my room...

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER COME BACK”
Reviews.Author: eyaredo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 12 nights with my wife from aug28 to sept 9'11 1-the location was good 2-the rooms are so small and without refrigrator though clean 3-the service was so terrible, When we came from our last dinner it was 2:00pm. I told the person on the front desk who was also the manager Mr Saleem to finalize my bills to settle it in the morning. as we go up to the room the key to our room was not working so I have to go down to the front desk to ask help. The most funny thing starts here. The key to our room was locked by the manager Mr Saleem. I ask him why he did that he told me to settle the breakfast and other billls worth AED237 first before he unlock it. oh my God!!!! the next thing i ask was about our luggage and he told me they are in the room. I got angry because i was so tired and i want to sleep. i have to deposit Euro 500 because i couldn't even talk that person and went to sleep. remember all the time we argue on the desk my wife was on the corridor waiting for me. fortunately, she came down and comfort me. I want to leave the judgment to yourselves ENGINEER YARED ADUGNA eyaredo@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is NOT where things are happening in Dubai, it's about 30 minutes away on the metro and is very close to the station - Minutes away by foot in fact. The biggest problem at this hotel was the staff, I am thinking of inventing a new word to describe how slow they are. It is probably because they are massively understaffed but check in took about an hour and check out just as long. If ever you have a problem there is no way on earth you can get a quick solution to it. There are always many people at the desk and if you use the phone in the room then you may as well just talk to yourself. We made about 3 requests such as extra pillow and not a single one was followed up. The rooms are clean and actually really nice. The hotel is also spotless. The manager of this hotel has no common sense either - The ridiculous price of a beer is £7, thats not a typo - SEVEN POUND for 500ml of Beer. But if you want that beer and are staying at the IBIS you have to stay in the bar with it, if you are staying at the joining hotel (Novotel) you can take it to your room. The menu in the bar is poor and overpriced. Yet the room service menu is actually reasonable. Can you order an item off the room service menu and take it to the bar to have a drink with it - No. It is just ridiculous and completely ill thought out. If you are looking for a clean hotel out of the action and won the lottery last night or are Tee Total then stay here - Other wise get nearer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “There are better IBIS in Dubai !”
Reviews.Author: marePadova Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quality of service provided is very poor compare with the same you can get at other Ibis in Dubai, as well as the standard of services is very poor. Breakfast room / restaurant quite dirty, which is the general feeling you get at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for its price & location!”
Reviews.Author: bangloboy
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights for our quick stay in Dubai. The location is great - across the street from the Deira City centre and close to the Gold souk as well. We chose this hotel because the price was great and is under 10 minutes from Dubai International Airport. We went with a standard room that overlooked the Deira City centre. Room was clean and well kept with the usual amenities. Bathroom was a little tiny but was sufficient for the both of us. The hotel lobby has wifi for its customers as well as a snack store (which was steep so we didn't use). Checkin was smooth and staff are friendly & helpful. Please do not use the hotel cab service under no circumstances. Just walk 10 seconds to the main road and grab the regular orange-cream Dubai cabs as they are far far cheaper. The hotel cab offered us to take us to the airport for 25 Dirhams which we thankfully declines because it actually cost us 8 Dirhams! Overall the hotel is good for a budget stay with basic amenities provided and most importantly clean & well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: jamisa57
Reviews.Content: The lobby was pleasant, the hotel was clean, the ladies' powder room in the lobby smelled so nice and it was very clean, the restaurant provided a good meal, and in a different room in the morning the breakfast (included in the cost of the hotel) was nice and had quite a bit of variety considering the abundance of different ethnic groups staying at the hotel. The reception was a bit haphazard as they are only there to give you your key, and English was not spoken or understood by all behind the desk. No help with baggage, although one very kind man behind reception helped me with my bags and my friend's bags onto a luggage carrier. Across the road (very busy road) was a wonderful mall, and I spent quite a time, and money, in there!! This hotel is, as I now realise, only for short stays. No swimming pool, but you can swim at the Novotel next door, for a small fee. Looking back on it all, it was basic, clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Colour_splash
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, close to a mall, easy to find(i had hired a car and found it in less than 30 mins with google map). Really good price as well.=

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMak
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Dubai for two nights and searched for a reasonably priced hotel with good connection to the airport and sights/malls. And that is exactly what I got with the Ibis Deira City Centre. The hotel is a short taxiride away from the airport and is located opposite of a shopping mall (one in which you won't get lost), in which you will find common retail brands, a food court and a huge supermarket. Furthermore it is a 5min walk away from the Dubai Metro which will basically bring you to most attractions in Dubai (Dubail Mall, Mall of the Emirates, Burj Khalifa etc) I arrived pretty early in Dubai and was happy to be able to check-in at 10am. One positive aspect was that they indeed provided me with a room that I requested. A few weeks before my stay I messaged them asking for a room on a higher floor facing the Burj Khalifa side (only visible on clear days though), and that is exactly what I got. The rooms are a typical Ibis size, not too big, but for me it was more than enough. It is clean and looked fresh, and that's all that I hoped and asked for. As previosly mentioned there is no free internet in the room. I just checked my mails in the lobby where you'll find wireless as well as 3 PC's. In summary the hotel is very good value for money and seems perfect for me for a short stopover without spending too much money on accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “0 value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nam7584
Reviews.Content: only advantage of this hotel is the location,near to city center and metro station.rest every thing pathetic.no drinking water in room most horrible thing there is no glass to drink water.no toileteries only bath towels and liquid soap provided.cooling was not proper.to use the wifi you have to carry your laptop and go to the lobby which is crowded and no privacy.Wired internet available in room is chargeable.even the basic hotels in dubai are offering free-wifi in rooms.breakfast stuff is horrible since it was included in my package i tried for three days.staffs are not friendly.u can see the don't care attitude from the reception it self.i was there from 24 jul to 27 jul for a business trip.replies from their manager for the trip advisor reviews shows their amateur behaviour.same reply for all the reviews.my advice try to avoid this place i feel they r never going to improve.there is not much international channels available in tv.rooms are small and congusted.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful when I arrived early and managed to find me a room so I could rest. On my return from Jeddah although they were fully booked they provided me with a room where I could change prior to catching my flight back to the UK. The service was equivalent to a much more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zabs_6
Reviews.Content: Great location , was quite amazed with the hotel, lovely breakfast , amazing contemporary decor and finishes- helpful staff and will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: traveltalesCumbria_
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ibis for the second time as we were impressed the first time we stayed a couple of years ago.The location is ideal as it is close to the airport and everything that is worth seeing in Dubai is within easy reach.The only slight problem we had is that the beds are on the firm side for us but are otherwise very comfortable.Outside the hotel,the addition of the new monorail system is a real boon for getting around as it is cheap and easy to use.We used it as a great way to see much of the city as there are stops for most places of interest.If the monorail didn't go direct to where we wanted to be ,we got off at the nearest station to our destination and took a taxi for the rest of the way thus saving a lot of money for long fares.Opposite the hotel is the Deira city centre shopping mall.Good for shopping and watching the world go by.On the ground floor there is an excellent food mall where it is possible to get good food at reasonable rates as food in Dubai can be a bit pricey if eating in the bigger outlets.Go to the spice market and have some fun getting your spices from the local traders,they are all friendly but can be persistent once you are in the store,just be sure what you want and enjoy the experience!Dubai is a great place and we try to make it a stopover when we can as we find the experience is a great intro to the Arabian way of life.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: livedie
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here during our 2 day visit to Dubai. We were both pleasantly surprised at the service this hotel offered. While the front desk were often quite busy, they never refused to offer any assistance or help to us. We had a room on the 8th floor. The room was quite small, but for the price we paid for it, it was really good. Clean and tidy and reasonably comfortable. The bed was a bit small, but we managed. The bathroom really good too. Breakfast was good too. There was usually a taxi out the front of the hotel, so very convenient. If there wasn't, it wasn't too much of a wait for one. I would definitely be coming here next time, if I were to visit Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Ghannami
Reviews.Content: Very good location, rooms are clean and tidy, simple but does not contain a small fridge like other hotels. However, it was a good experience and recommend to friends and would like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic experience staying at ibis Deira City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Rajiv2804
Reviews.Content: Normally I reftrain complaining about services of hotels - as post my visits to more than 100 hotels worldwide in more than 30 countries - However, I thought of putting message here on this site to safeguard others from hotel called Ibis Deira City Centre, Dubai. My stay in this hotel could not last for more than 4 hours and the experience was some how as under: 1. No greetings or welcome message at reception - as people were busy talking with each other ( first ever experience in through out my life) 2. I booked my room with breakfast, however the lady at reception is asking me to pay 55 AED by cash / credit card towards breakfast..? 3. Upon asking her not to settle the bill by credit card (as I settle whole bill by paying in AED)- she still charged by credit card as well and I got to know from my credit card issuing bank - for which I've to write serious note to them - as I felt, I'm being cheated! 4. The room key given to me was not activated and I have to come back from elevator to reception to activiate it...! 5. I lost my patience with all above treatment and upon asking for senior person to complain - there was a guy called Saleem, started advicing me on whacky hotel rules (as if I don't know Accor group - Finally I've to show my A-Club membership card to shut him..!) All the above experience had happened between 5.30 to 6.00 am on 16th July'11 morning... Hope others will have serious note of my experience...!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RhondaSydney
Reviews.Content: Close to transport, airport and Deira Garden City Mall is across the road. Good, clean basic rooms, clean fluffy towels and good bed linen. I don't understand the comments about no one to take bags to rooms - how did you get your bags to/from of the airport - to a taxi - etc? - not a service that I look for or need. Good breakfast and excellent cafe for snacks etc, reasonable prices. Some staff could be a bit off-hand and unhelpful but mostly they were pleasant and friendly. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is no body to take the bags to the rooms. I know this is a minor issue but this is very esential service In the hotels. And would like to see someone to carry the bags in the futur. One more thing is the hotel must be equipped with a wireless Internet in all rooms. I know it is available in the lobby but it would be great if this service available in the rooms as well.

Reviews.Title: “Value Room”
Reviews.Author: nkalraisi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is no need for service, it is help your self hotel take your bags and go to your room. all others are realy valued such as cleanliness, location, proxy to Business areas / trading, car park available, etc. I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location just across the road of city center mall all what u need is around you,wi fi available in lobby ,good food and service. Staff were very nice. It is very close to airport for those who wants to stay overnight waiting for a connecting flight it cost only 2-3dollars to the airport, I highly recommend this hotel for a short stay in dubai

Reviews.Title: “place to be”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Over all cleanliness, rooms and sleep quality were excellent. however front office staff particularly morning shift were seems grumpy and unhappy when dealing with guests. I thing need to improve this area otherwise its an excellent hotel to recommend a friends.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Joy056
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my adult daughter. we were very impressed with the Ibis for the price. It is quite new and everything was lovely. Fabulous buffett breakfast. The room & bathroom was quite small but for the price....we enjoyed our stay there. The shopping mall directly opposite was great. The staff were very helpful & got us a yellow taxi (much cheaper) instead of the white ones which are always outside the door. Only 11AD to the airport at 5:30am....not too much traffic then. We stayed at the Ibis 2 nights, I wished it was longer, I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A real good value for money. Good location opposite City Centre Shopping Mall, Next to Metro Train , Clean rooms and free internet and a good accor group of hotel in dubai. Breakfast is served from 4am to 12 noon .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. Staff were very helpful. We arrived early in the morning and even knowing that check in was after lunch, we were asked if we wanted our luggages stored while we check the places near the hotel for shopping. We were impressed with the room when we got onto it and was very quiet even close to the main road and breakfast was well worth the money. Great access to shopping centres and airport. Very well recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my stayed at ibis deira city center”
Reviews.Author: tahashem Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good hotel location i stayed 3 night ,good room space and clean , near to deira metro station and city center mall but for value u can get better as some rate money because no minibar, breakfast it's expensive for 15 $ not included ,i prefer holiday inn express because it's have mini bar in all rooms with breakfast if there holiday inn near to ur destination i advice it for u better than ibis .

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Kanyada
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place, clean and friendly staff. I had an opportunity to test their response time and there was a guy at my room to fix an issue with my shower in under 5mins..and better still he sorted it out in 2. Only problem i had was lack of a safe in the room (not that i doubt the security) and the fact that internet access had to be paid for separately. Its however free in the lobby but i will be happier if that service is extended to the rooms for free...

Reviews.Title: “an average hotel..”
Reviews.Author: samontana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Ibis Deira for 3 nights for business purpose. The hotel is located 15 min away from the World Trade Center by taxi. The best thing about the location for me is the shopping mall opposite of the street. The breakfast was a standart of Ibis but it was not seem so appetitive. SoI had my breakfast at Novotel (just next to Ibis).. There was not many price difference for breakfast. The room was clean but the bathrooms are too small.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: birdwatcherNewcastle
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Ibis.It is an ideal base to explore Dubai as it is central and convenient for the metro system.The rooms and public areas are clean and comfortable.Use of the swimming pool at the neighbouring Novotel cost 30 AED each,but one can stay all day,from 7am till dusk(we arrived at 7am after an overnight flight from UK; it is useful to be able to put one's head down on a sunbed until check-in opens at the Ibis at 2pm!).Being across the road from a large shopping centre and supermarket ,it is possible to have an inexpensive stay in Dubai! I would recommend the Ibis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 mins from airport, 5min walk to metro, cheap, clean, new, next to shopping”
Reviews.Author: sydjetsetter86
Reviews.Content: Price: approx 80AUD Location: 5min drive to the airport without traffic. Cross the road and your at a shopping centre. 5min walk to the metro. Room: Reasonable size but smallish. very clean. Bed could be better but not bad. Great shower. Only 1 shower gel/shampoo combo. Wifi: free in the lobby only. Wired in the rooms at a charge Breakfast: overpriced and not particularly nice. No roomservice and the food at the cafe was affordable but cold and poor quality. Its like they bought frozen food from the supermarket and made it. Very slow service. Service: Check in was a bit slow and no dedicated A-Club counter. Overall: my second stay. I use this hotel as a place to crash for the night when I have a long layover. If your staying for longer Id recommend the novotel that its connected to.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and staff are friendly and attentive. Good place to stay while transiting through Dubai. Rooms with a window that overlook the pool are nicer than the ones that overlook an empty lot/construction site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Jameelo
Reviews.Content: I was stranded at the airport - couldnt get to my flight to sudan due to visa issue. Feeling tired and not sure what to do I decided to stay at this hotel. The place is nice, room comes with basic stuff and the location is good. This hotel is lecated just opposote Deira Mall!! Very convinient to get food or watch movies or even do shopping. Its just 5-10 minutes away from the airport. The service was great. EMAD, the front desk staff was really helpful, helping me out with my problems - at least I dont feel alone staying in Dubai. Maybe one they can improve is probably they can prepare a few more iron and board(not included in room, need to get it from the front desk). I've asked a couple times but just couldnt get it. If you have a laptop, you can use the internet from your room with extra charges per hour. If you have Ipad, there is free wifi spot at the lobby. Asked the front desk for the username/password. I would recommend this hotel as the location is just great.

Reviews.Title: “my stay in Ibis City Center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For the last 3 visits to Dubai, I choose this hotel because of its excellent location, friendly staff, cleanliness and comfort and close to public transportation to travel within Dubai. In addition to its reasonable price for the quality of the hotel. I have decided to stay in this hotel any time I travel to Dubai. Only the following two neds attention of the management; 1- Pilows are to be changed to a bigger one 2- Towels are worn out and need to be replaced as early as possible. I definitely highly recommend to all my friends to stay in the hotel whenever they travel to Dubail.

Reviews.Title: “beware the taxi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was efficient. breakfast was well presented and fresh. the receptionist referred us to the black non metered taxi at the entrance and he was aggressive in demanded more money than agreed when we got to the airport. only problem with a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ermicat
Reviews.Content: This chain hotel is situated very close to the airport, and fairly close to the older centre of Dubai. For a short break more interested in the culture than the beaches it is ideal. The hotel is functional more than luxurious as you would expect, but very clean and very good value for money. For the class of hotel the staff were very helpful and informative. It is just opposite the Deira mall with its extensive range of shops and eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy night”
Reviews.Author: Paul293925
Reviews.Content: Overall it is good value, clean and smart. I couldn't sleep though because I could hear all the doors on my corridor opening and slamming shut all night (including 4am). Also, could hear music outisde at 5am every morning. Also one of the lifts didn't work which meant going in and out of other lifts trying the swipe cards in multiple different ways.I paid in advance for breakfast, but when I went down to breakfast the girl tried to charge me for breakfast. I told her I'd already paid and then it took her quite a while to 'check' if I had paid (embarrasing).

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location compared to the overpriced hotels in Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: Ithinkthis
Reviews.Content: Cheaper rates if you book online direct. Much better value than 4* and 5* hotels I have stayed in over the years in Dubai. Rooms clean, modern, lack an in-room safe but are good overall. Gym and swimming pool are available next door at the Novotel? Costs about AED30 to use them both. The gym is tiny, poorly equipped, basically it's crap. Free Wi-Fi if you have your own computer and use it in the lobby area, otherwise the normal rip-off rates for use in the rooms. I'll stay there again from now on as it is half the price of 4* and 5* hotels. Location is excellent if you are wanting to visit the Deira City Centre and airport. It took me 4 minutes to get to Terminal one at 05:30 and 20 minutes in the afternoon rush hour. Plenty of taxis about it seemed. Food quality is good as is the breakfast. In summary the location, quality and value of the rooms in a totally overpriced city makes this a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: C0uple_fr0m_Hungary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 nights and we were more than statisfied. We booked the room trough the Dertour Meier German Travelagancy. We got a very nice room with a very nice wiew to the city on the higher level. The bed was very comfortable, we slept very well. Location is great, you can reach easily by metro or by taxi the most sights-seeings, the souks, the Greek, the historical area. Free internet with PC-s very usefull. Opposit the hotel is the Deira city mall, great possibility for shopping. Staff is helpful. Breakfast and terasse is great also. Thank you for your hospitaly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny... or should i say Dhiram ;)”
Reviews.Author: kikunaik
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with Deira City Centre mall & Tube Station bang opposite the hotel. Rooms are a bit small with no frills (Carry toothpaste, soaps, etc) but comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear! You're not getting value for money.”
Reviews.Author: djb4439
Reviews.Content: I don't think that reviews should be allowed that are eulogies to the satisfaction achieved. That's what we are paying for anyway aand moreover they sway peoples' opinions when they should really see the downside. This hotel has the surliest and least welcoming staff at reception. Superficially, like everything else in Dubai, it looks very clean. However the bedroom is standard IBIS quality but it's the bathroom here that really let's the place down. Two bathtowels and shower mat only, no hand towels; No toiletries and no cold water. (The cold water in Dubai aparently is always tepid at best). But when you look at the floor you will see all sorts of little creatures dashing about andonto the carpet of the bedroom. Incidentally, We have always used IBIS and ACCOR HOTELS when travelling for the simple reasons that you know exactly what you will get and that the price will be fair. IBIS, Deira City Centre, DUBAI was for us an exception - there are other IBIS hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not 7 stars, but close to metro, so easy to get everywhere”
Reviews.Author: rtnalle
Reviews.Content: Rather we spend our money on attractions, so that's why we booked this particular hotel. Room was ok, nothing fancy, but location on 9th floor, with Queenbed made sleeping easy and joyfull. Shower/Toilet was good, but the soappump were stuck. Views were like everywhere in Dubai, artificial, since it's built on desert which means sand everywhere. There was also a closet for your clothes in the room, working desk, with a connection to internet (expensive!), phone, tv with remote and AC. Breakfast was ok, not quite the ones that youre used to, but enough to start the day without being forced to go some cafe just to get your self fuelled for the day. Instead for paying ridiculous rates for the internet, just return to the CheckIn Lobby, since there you have Wi-Fi connection, if your computer is equipped with wireless. There was also 3 HP computers hooked to the internet by the Hotel, which where free to use. Reason to choose this hotel was it's location close to the NEW metro. Just few steps away and metro being the cheapest way to travel, it was really nice. With it you can get more/less to all those necessary places you might thing being worth a visit, e.g. Dubai Mall (IceRink, Aquarium, Burj Khalifa), Mall of the Emirates (SkiDubai), Palm Island Jumeirah (Hotel Atlantis, Aquaventures, Burgerfuel) and so on. In my opion the down side of Dubai is the difficulty of walking anywhere, since it's build and equipped that way that you ALWAYS have to take a taxi to get anywhere, even you first use the metro. Then again there is system that fixes the prices, so it's always even money, yet the meter first shows 41,70, but after you give 50, it's even 50.. Also Lexus taxis are pretending to be taxis, yet there is no rateemeters and the prices are divided to 35 UAED's depending on the distance. Short is 35, next is 70 and after that it is 105 and so on. So when having metro to Jumeirah it was 4,20, compared to normal taxi which was 48,70 so 50 and might have been with Lexus service something like 105 or even the next level so 140 uaed. Been there, seen it.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Bellafran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value. The rooms are fairly compact but they are well presented and very clean. The lobby is a busy place as WiFi access to the Internet is freely accessible there and for a reasonable fee you can also access the Internet in your room. The beds are so comfortable and blinds ensure a quiet and darkened space to relax in. Breakfast offers a fairly wide range in a buffet style for guests to choose from, and you'd have to be pretty fussy if you didn't find something you liked. Security boxes are available to store your valuables and staff were quite helpful in this regard. Being new to Dubai, I asked if there was a tourism office nearby or some brochures - but the staff member I spoke to was unable to help me with this, but fortunately I was able to learn this for myself. Just across the road is the Deira City Centre shopping mall, which has a tourism booth and is also the starting point for the Big Bus Tour - a hop on, hop off bus tour of Dubai, with recorded commentary in 8 languages, which I found a great way to get around and see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “amazing Dubai”
Reviews.Author: lyank
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights,some 35min from the airport by cab, travelled with three friends,shared 2 double average size rooms, with 2 king single beds,aircondition worked well too, great shower and towels daily, had the best sleeps the staff were very helpful,check in was rapid,in no time we were showered and out across the road checking out the shops at the Deira Center,just one fo the many malls buit on a grand scale, we found out later, a shoppers paradise, the Big bus tour company left from there and the railway station was rond the corner as well, could of caught the train had we known, the breakfast buffet was great with continental, hot foods salads and fresh fruits, the restaurant served up wonderful food to suit and at reasonable prices,recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cute and nice”
Reviews.Author: irfankhanlives
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very nice compared to the price. Though it has a lesser star rating, it is a very good place. The star rating is low because of certain compliance but the hotel is at par with the best. Though the room is small its very boutique. Breakfast was like a 5 star and the location is very good. Very close to airport and right across the Cit mall.

Reviews.Title: “stay in duabi in good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: you can reach the hotel by the tube from the Airport and can go to Dira city center for shopping and food

Reviews.Title: “Very good, decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: djmcbell
Reviews.Content: Right then. First off, I do write long reviews so bear with me. We didn't have a great deal of money and were staying in Dubai for three nights. As much as we'd have loved to find the deal a friend of mine found (six nights at Atlantis, with flights, for £600 - unfortunately his wife went and booked a week in Wales) we asked our travel agent to find us the cheapest there was, and he found this - the Ibis Deira City Centre. Some relatives actually had stayed there a year before and found it very nice and in a great location. So off to Dubai we go! We'd actually flown to Melbourne, done some stuff there, then to Sydney, and now Dubai on the way back to Manchester. In order to save some more money we were actually flying into Abu Dhabi and travelling into Dubai on a coach but that's another story. Long plane flight, coach trip and then taxi ride later we arrived at probably about 9am. Fair enough. The hotel is actually on a main road (isn't everything in Dubai?) and is opposite the Deira City Centre shopping mall. Although check in isn't until 2pm we go in anyway and try our luck. As luck would unfortunately have it, nothing is available. The staff did say we could try at 1pm and see if there's anything then, so plus marks there for the staff offering that, and minus luck marks for us. The staff did offer to hang onto our luggage for us, which we were grateful for, and we went to the shopping centre to kill a few hours, then came back at 1-ish and found that a room was available. I must mention that, despite being billed as "very cheap" according to the travel agent, the standards were very good. The hotel foyer looked clean with three PCs set up for use and international newspapers. The room was also nice - plenty of space, a decent enough bed and a spacious bathroom with walk-in shower and line to hang towels on. Definitely better than expected. Only real problem was that I was woken up at 5am (I think) by what I assume is the "call to prayer". Never mind - that's an issue with Dubai itself, not the hotel as the noise was coming from outside. The view from where we were was also pretty good - you could see across the shopping mall to the Burj Khalifa (definitely something worth doing). The TV also picked up a large amount of TV stations, along with a lot of western stuff (given the amount of nudity there is in True Blood you would have thought it wouldn't be screened, but there it is). The breakfast was also decent - an okay variety of warm and cold food including breads, cereals, sausages, beans, toast, juice and others. Nothing spectacular though it was better than the comparatively bland breakfasts I'd had at other places on our trip in Australia. Though check out was at about 10am we were flying back at 2am and so would need our luggage held until about 9pm (otherwise we couldn't do anything and would die of boredom). Again, the hotel kindly held our luggage for us until we came back and used a taxi (they're everywhere in Dubai! Just walk out of the hotel and there's normally three there waiting!) to get to the airport. I will briefly note that, though it didn't affect us, the hotel does not have swimming facilities, though for a small supplement you can use the facilities at the neighbouring Novotel. We found this hotel to be in a good spot - again, across the road from the Deira City Centre shopping mall (good for all your shopping needs, though nowhere near as spectacular as the Dubai Mall) and about three minutes walk from a metro station. Taxis were available and we found the neighbourhood (well, our short walks to the metro) to be one where we felt safe (having said that, Dubai is supposed to be one of the safest places around). The hotel was good value - nothing spectacular, but it's not going to be. The breakfast was good and it had all the amenities necessary. I wasn't sure whether to award a three or a four star. I think that, for the price and value for money, as well as the helpfulness of the staff (they did try to help when we asked them about Ferrari World and the metro, but unfortunately didn't know much about them) I think I'll award it four.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for One or Two Nights!”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: We spent one evening at Ibis Hotel at Deira in late September 2010. The location could not be better. We arrived at 8.30pm and our flight was the next day late in the afternoon. It was really hot and humid even late that evening, and I felt lucky that I had booked here because there is a huge Mall just opposite the hotel. The room was comfortable, and very clean. The bathroom was small, but we were there for just one evening. The fact that it did not have a mini bar to keep some cool water or one or two fruit was the biggest disadvantage. We decided not to have breakfast at the hotel since there was the Mall just a few metres across and it seems that we did the best thing. We had everything we needed at the Starbacks café in the Mall. We spent the whole time at the Mall till the moment we had to leave the hotel. If I ever visit Dubai again, I would certainly pick this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hanimex99
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is within 10 minutes drive from the Airport. Checkin process was fast enough. However, the reception desk can get very busy at times. The room was fresh, clean and to a good standard. Bathroom was also the same, but maybe for some a little tight. The Buffet breakfast was great, serving hot food. A good start to the day.
