One of the best breakfasts I have had in a 3 star hotel. The location is ideal for sight seeing. The metro station is within a 5 minute walk on the same road. The Deira City Centre Mall is across the road (for quick access just walk through the mall's car park - I'm a slow walker and took me 3 minutes). Taxis outside the hotel are very easy to find. [The Deira Mall might not be the biggest or best in Dubai, but is modern enough. Its very converient, to grab something to eat before returning to the hotel after a busy day out. Also the 'Big Tour Bus' for dubai also has a stop/ticket stand based at the mall.] Was really happy with this Ibis hotel, altrough only a 3 star, I've stayed at worst 4 star rated hotels. Would go back anytime. I've said this before - please shop around the websites for the best price, and if you can try to book at least a month in advance

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Resat_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and not clean. The photo-print of blood for killed mosquitos almost every where in the room. (I changed 3 rooms and all just the same). At night I could not sleep because of generator or A/C (I could not recognize) voice. Loudy and stopless. Terrible hotel...............

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Wton_Wanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one night stop over and found it perfectly adequate. Close to airport and pick up worked fine. Like a lot of hotels, official check in time is not until 2.00 pm but there is a luggage store. Facilities, service all as per usual for Ibis chain. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not the one for you but if you want a clean, comfortable overnight stay at a reasonable price this will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay ...”
Reviews.Author: Yves_C_78 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well situated with excellent service and great pool space. Watch your steps in the main dining room cause the marble tile is very very dangerous as soon as any liquid is on ....

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average Hotel - Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: thetartanview Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location near shopping mall and metro. Standard Novotel, although the service was poor compared with other Novotels.

Reviews.Title: “crap service & wait 7 hours to check in a room!!”
Reviews.Author: bonjovi5555
Reviews.Content: awful reception lady not helpful virgin rep crap 7 hours waiting for a room when you are knackered!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lousy check in staff”
Reviews.Author: PrairiePat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Tourism Office Staff at Deira City Centre Mall. It is accross the street from a major mall and 5 mins from the metro station. Less then 10 mins cab ride to airport or you can ride the metro right to Dubai Terminal 1 for $1US. Hotel was very clean, room on the 8th floor looked brand new. The rooms are a little on the small side but as a place to sleep and hang your hat it is perfect. No wifi in rooms but you have plug in internet for a fee. Recommend you book online as you will get a better rate than walking in. I booked from the lobby wifi on hotels.com and saved about 50 dirhams. I found the staff at the reception to be less than helpful. As I waited for my online booking to come through, I watched as one guest after another had issues with their booking and the unfriendly staff. This was not a dealbreaker for me however, as I found the rate and location to outweigh the poor quality staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not arrive early!”
Reviews.Author: Wouldyouadamandeveit
Reviews.Content: Sadly we arrived at this hotel at six oclock in the morning after the "red eye" flight from Brisbane. I did not expect to book in straight away but was disappointed that we did not get our room until 11-30, after being promised that it would be ready at 10.00. On the good side they did allow us to store our suitcases out of the way & we were able to have a wash & brush up. As we sat in reception drinking tea we noticed several people in the same situation as us, so beware either book the night before or be prepared to wait. The hotel is only 10 mins from the airport by car, is very modern & clean & has one of the largest shopping malls opposite the hotel open from 10.00 until midnight. We had a double room on the 9th floor which was small but perfectly formed with a walk in shower, no tea/coffee facilities & no fridge or safe. There is no pool but they have an arrangement with The Novotel next door. The snack bar is reasonably priced & the breakfast in the morning was a buffet hot & cold with plenty of choice. We found the hotel to be busy & yet slept soundly with no noise once you are inside your room. There were vending m/c's on each floor for water & drinks again at a reasonable price. One note of caution regarding the internet facility in the room, on booking out, the hotel tried to charge us 60 dirhams for using it when we had not used it at all --- after standing my ground they finally cancelled the charge, BUT beware as it seems to be a regular occurence! The daily rate advertised outside the hotel is 324aed with 5.4 dirhams to the pound .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: tanicholls
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the ibis Deira city hotel, booked through Virgin holidays. Ibis Deira is a great location. There is a huge mall opposite, and metro station. We found the metro so cheap and easy to use. I would definately recommend the Dubai big bus tour, if you have time do the two day package. (red and blue tour) Included in the package are walking tours of the souk markets and a douw cruise. Another must is a trip up to the 124th floor of the Burj Kalifa. Pre-book your tickets online before you visit to save yourself Aed300. We went up late afternoon to see the sun go down and the nightglow. We did the Jeep safari across the sand dunes with Alpha tours, great fun, take a sick bag if you suffer with travel sickness! If you get time have a day at the Jumeriah Beach Park, only AED5 just to chill out on the beautiful beach. The malls are amazing, even if you just people watch. I think the Dubai mall was best especially for the fountain show every half an hour staring at 6pm. The city is so clean, the people are very friendly.& you feel very safe,

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, help full staff, shades swimming”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time in Deira, very well located just behind the Deira City Center Mall, at walking distance from Metro. this location isvery well suited for people leaving and entering Dubai to get started and ready to wrap up. Just 10 minutes from Al Satwa by Metro, allowing you to set up DEWA, also the Wafi-Mall is at a short Taxi drive away, allowing you tset up DEWA there. also since it is close to Metro, tis location allows for a good launching pad to discover new Dubai. The hotel is close to the airport so within 10 minutes by Taxi you can get here or get to the airport in case this is the entry or leaving platform. The hotel is luxurious and has many amenities that equate well to the life-style in Dubai. The pool is between the buildings of Novotel and Ibis, and allows for a shaded swim. not to scorch the skin and not to be overly heated as the pool is chilled to acceptable levels to stay and cool down. Lovely place with the kids and relaxed well.

Reviews.Title: “value hotel and in good location”
Reviews.Author: mambaAthens
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights after a stopover from beijing. The room was a little bit small but ok for me as i was alone, very clean always the a/c on as it is very hot in dubai. The reception desc was very helpful and kind. Outside you can find a mall(deira city center) with a lot of shops,fast food, and hypermarket carrefour. Also there is a metro station outside the hotel and taxis. Avoid the luxury "taxis" because they will double charge you!! Take only the public taxis and they are very very cheap conversely the european taxis. If you want to go at the beach you can take the metro until marina station and then with taxi.It costed me about 20 dirhams. Also the airport is very close to the hotel you can take the metro and it takes about 10' to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that fits your budget”
Reviews.Author: friendshipblooms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis Deira City Center for a night. Quick and efficient check-in and check-out. Staff very polite, courteous and accomodative. They allowed me late check-out without hesitation. Rooms and bathroom very neat and clean though a bit small. Excellent buffet breakfast. Very good location. City Center Mall just across the road. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dkraina
Reviews.Content: I had gone to participate in the Paper Arabia Fair in Dubai.I have been visiting Dubai for the last many years either alone on business or with family .We have always stayed in Bur Dubai in hotels ranging around USD 100++. It was our experience that wherever we stayed ,we had to come to Malls like City Centre,Lamcy Plaza etc for shopping or leisure.This would involve a daily expense in terms of Taxi and not to mention the jams etc on th eroad and hence wastageof time. I chose Ibis Deira Cit Centre precisely because of the locational advantage.It is just across the road from City Centre Shopping mall where you have Carrefour and other stores.The Metro station is nearby and so is the availabilty of Taxis etc.Even on business trips the location appears at centre since it is equidistant from Old Dubai and new Dubai areas like Sheikh Zayed Road etc.The hotel/rooms were clean,security systems in place and internet booking was a breeze.The rate of Dh 300 was pretty good . The downside was the absence of room service .Breakfast was extra,over the room rate and appeared expensive as per normal standard.Even the reception takes a long to lift the phone in case of a query and always appear overbusy.No wifi internet in the rooms and even the wired room internet was expensive from hotel or Dubai standards.Apart from City Centre or other malls there were no "bazars" to stroll around if one prefers that.Be careful about check-in times.Generally it is difficult to get a room before the prescribed check-in time and often becomes a problem as travellers mostly plan flights which arrive in the mornings to take full day time advantage. All in all a great locational advantage hotel with good cleanliness and security systems.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not great room”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_e_hall
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in March 2010 in a twin room. The hotel is good value, compared to what you could pay for the same location, but I wouldn't have liked to stay for a week. The beds were incredibly uncomfortable, and the shower made the whole bathroom wet. The bathroom itself was quite tiny, and the room wasn't exactly large. However it was clean, and the view was great. I wouldn't stay here again, except if i was ridiculously skint - but then, there's not much point going to Dubai if you're skint!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: peteandcarolbrisbane
Reviews.Content: Don't expect customer service or any of the arab staff to speak english...

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aila26
Reviews.Content: we stayed in ibis hotel in Feb.2010, where was so comfortable, they served just break fast, but it was very good and various, the location was excellent, just front of the city center mall, rooms were clean and staffs are very friendly, I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an inexpensive, relax and comfortable travel. there is no pool, spa and club there, but the hotel has shuttle to the beach in every morning at 11. also the hotel is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “clean ,economic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vida47
Reviews.Content: we were in a 4 star hotel,but as our trip turned out to be longer than we expected,we had to move to a cheaper hotel,and really it was better than that 4 star.it has a very good location,opposite the Deira city centre and the metro station.it was very clean ,quiet and beautiful .It is not luxurious ,but it has all you need .I specially liked the modern decoration and the minimalistic style of the rooms.wherever I want to go ,first I check and if there is an ibis hotel nearby ,it's usually the first choice. vida Iran

Reviews.Title: “nice desing, clean, terrible front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTrident
Reviews.Content: i was there on business, the hotel was new, rooms were lovely and clean etc... the only problem was the frontdesk staff completely unimpowered, rude and acted as if they were defect robots.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sarthak27
Reviews.Content: Amzing rates!!! This is how anyone who has lived here will start off. Despite of being primely located adjacent to Deira City centre in dubai, they manage to keep room tarrifs all throughout the year at about 300 AED. As i have already said the hotel is extremely primely located. With one of the cities most popular mall at a furlong. More than that the metro station is also very close by. This makes commuting in dubai very easy. With no room service whatsoever, it becomes somewhat a pain, but then it is negated by the self-service attitude of the whole place. Even water has to be bought off the cooler placed in the hallway. It is apt for business travellers and backpakers. Honeymooners should stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: NK250
Reviews.Content: Excellent location Very close to Metro station. Just opposite the City Center Mall. Very neat and clean room. Overall excellent for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for So Many Reasons....”
Reviews.Author: Lissaana
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel was teeming with Russian and Ukraine prostitutes. So much so, that my friend Melanie was mistaken for one in an elevator, and she does not dress provocatively. You can pay cash for your stay, and that says it all for me. They don't keep your credit card on file as I found out when I checked out. These rooms ARE clean, but have NOTHING. No alarm clock, no mini bar, no safe, no iron or board, no shampoo, toothpaste or other supplies except watery gel soap. The rooms are cute and modern, and the lobby is as well, but other than that you are paying for accommodations that give you less than your own home. Why would you pay for that? I received a phone call from the front desk on the first morning after my stay, asking me how my stay was. This was at about 8:30am. I told the lady fine, until she woke me up with this stupid phone call. Who in the world calls a guest at 8:30am to ask how they are doing out of the blue? Unbelievable. I had been up since 3:30 that morning, so I was pretty ticked off about it. I asked that she never call my room again. There were no appliance adapters for shavers, etc or power converters for 110V appliances. Just so low-budget. You could also hear EVERYTHING. I was awakened three times during the night listening to my neighbors' doors slam shut. Oh yeah---this hotel also has no pool. But you can pay to use the Novotel pool next door. (Uhm---no thanks). Basically, it was a cute, totally low-budget, friendly yet slightly sleazy place to stay. I won't be doing it again. Not my thing. Try the Hyatt hotels in Dubai, or the Radisson. They are nice, comfortable and affordable with great service. You get what you pay for, believe me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: BetaniaAddisAbaba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times before (this fourth trip is for over 15 days) and I always enjoyed my stay. The staff is wonderful at the front desk and at the restaurants, a great cleaner. The rooms are small, especially for more than one person, love the breakfast buffet and enjoyed the Bistro, Vertigo and Tala at Novotell for lunch and dinners. The location is the best part because it really is the center of Dubai and convenient shopping malls. My biggest complaint is the fact that Arabian Adventure, the booking agent for the hotel through Emirates?, overcharges for the rooms, absolutely not acceptabe (price per night right now is 299 AED but I found out that I am paying 130 USD per night). Outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: Gurmeet_Singh
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the hotel location, rooms, cleanliness etc. The only thing comes to my mind thinking about my stay here is terrible behaviour of reception people. They are not ready to hear your problem. Firstly, they give you a significant lower exchange rate as compared to USD. I had one night local currency avaialable with me at the time of check in and I deposited the same with them in addition to my credit card details. They blocked the telephone lines of my room and even demanded for my passport. Also, please avoid the pathetic breakfast for which they charge $15 or more. Awful experience, terrible guys, so unfriendly, felt like a torture.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MartanPrague
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel whole week and we were satisfied! We expected standard of 3 star hotel service and we received all what we needed. If you plan to visit Dubai atractions, it is the best location. Direct metro conection from the airport (2 stations only)! Metro and public bus station are 200m from hotel only. Big Deira shopping centrum incl. Carefour supermarket, food court and many restaurants is just oposit the hotel. :-) Our room was in highest level (9.) and was quiet (no noise from the street). No posible to open window - for "fresh" air is used the air condition only (individual setup). There were too little place in the room for things (no closed wardrobe). You can find automat with cold and cheap small bottles of wather and juice in the each hotel coridor. If you need to use public internet in hotel entrance hall, you have to pay min. 1 hour (25 Dh). It is free shuttle bus to the (Jumeirah) beach every day (at 11:00 from hotel, at 15:00 from the beach) - reservation day before necessary. Breakfast buffet offer is the same every day, but adequate and wide. If you use your room as the good foul territory (not for all day "living") is this hotel fully sufficient! :-) Really good value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PamYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Cleanliness in room could not be faulted, we left our towels on the bathroom floor & got clean towels every day of our 8 day stay, . Breakfast was good, the mini croissants & cafe latte were a particular favourite and the cereals were always fresh, there was also hot options eg scrambled eggs, beans etc. There is a nice terrace to have breakfast on. We took the complimentary service to the beach a couple of times (left at 11am back at 3pm). We found the Reception to be efficient and cleaning & restaurant staff friendly and helpful. Drinks from the Hotels vending machine(s) were very cheap (about 20p for a small bottle of water). The hotel is very close to Deira City Centre Mall, where in addition to the shopping there are many places to eat . Taxis are very reasonable & we found it easy to pick up outside the hotel, i dont think we waited more than about 30 seconds. All in all we found this a nice clean, no fuss hotel & would be happy to stay again if ever we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - ok for stopover”
Reviews.Author: AliH_JP
Reviews.Content: Ibis hotels are generally average aren't they? And this one is no different. We only stayed the one night in Dubai before our connecting flight in the morning. We got there very late so it really was just a bed for the night and it did what it said on the tin basically. Shower wasn't the cleanest ever but there was hot water. Bed was ok and on the plus side the hotel was nice and quiet. Reception staff could do with some training and I wouldn't want to stay here for any length of time but I would imagine this hotel has a lot of passing business trade and it wouldn't be the sort of place you'd book for a holiday of any length i guess! It does have a shopping centre opposite which is good if you have a couple of hours to kill before your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal economy stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Me_n_my_rucksack
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover in Dubai and a days sightseeing and stayed in the Ibis Deira. Firstly the complimentary shuttle met us from the flight as arranged which is a real plus. The staff at reception were friendly enough,but busy. The room was perfectly ok - clean and comfortable. The Mall is a 5 min walk away which was a godsend as our flight got in early evening and by the time we got to the hotel we needed a cheap fooderie and supplies and the Mall furnished our needs. Breakfast was surprisingly comprehensive and tasty for a budget hotel. Light and clean restauraunt. There is a Metro station 5 or 6 mins stroll away from the hotel allowing one to get in to the rest of the city (well - the parts with a metro - many of the stations were not complete in Mar 10). Complimentary shuttle got us back to the airport the next night - the Hotel happy to store our luggage for free. The only criticisms I would have is the lobby always seemed to be very busy with people waiting for, well we wer'nt sure, but always full of people ! And no free wifi. These aside an ideal hotel for what we wanted. Would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: BubG
Reviews.Content: Our room was modern, meticulously clean and had all the amenities we needed for a 3 night stopover. It's relatively close to the airport which is a blessing when you arrive in the middle of the night off a long flight! The location opposite Deira City Centre Mall makes it really convenient, and there's places open in the mall for breakfast (eg juice bar and patisserie). From the hotel it's also really easy to get to Old Deira (for the gold and spice souk) and to Jumeirah Beach. We took the complimentary shuttle bus to Jumeirah Beach Park but it's worth noting that this drops you off a fair way away from the Burj Al Arab... this is no big deal though as taxis are cheap or we caught a bus (#8A) for something different. Unlike some of the other reviews, we found the staff to be helpful and accommodating. They provided a hairdryer and power adapter promptly and were happy giving us directions. In particular, the service we received from Karem before our stay (to fix our booking) was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location but...”
Reviews.Author: Aix_Nice
Reviews.Content: I booked that hotel on the accorhotel website. I couldn't believe how cheap it was (300 dirhams). My room was small, but very clean. Brand new bathroom. the reception desk is useless. I called to ask which plug i required to charge my mobile phone and if i needed an adaptor, and the guy answered : "how do you want me to know" and hung up. Apart from the staff, great location The hotel is right in front of Carrefour, and the deira metro station. You can leave your luggage in a dedicated room whilst visiting the city. You might want to double check your bill as they tried to bill me a local call i never made

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: eMole
Reviews.Content: Everything that you read here regarding the Ibis Deira City Centre is true. The good: Well-priced, clean, contemporary, conveniently located (just opposite the Mall which opens till midnight on weekends and about AED16 one way to the Gold/Spice Souk by cab). The bad: Expect zero service (impersonal and poor attitude by front desk staff and even the manager) and zero amenities (you can use the Novotel's pool at a fee and internet connection is ridiculously priced). You get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Check-In with Original Passport or Wait like a Criminal”
Reviews.Author: FREAKWENTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I am an A-Club Gold Member with Accor Hotel and stayed in different IBIS' hotels all throughout SE and SW Asia. I was not allowed to check in at 1300 hours at my confirmed reservation because I did not have in my possession my original passport. My passport is with an embassy that I'm applying a visa for. Needless to say, I am in-transit in Dubai. I've informed the IBIS reception staff that I have a SCANNED copy of my passport temporarily till I get my passport back from the afternoon that same afternoon. I was initially told that I must also have a SCANNED copy of the IMMIGRATION stamp when I entered Dubai for their records. I've informed them that this is the first time that I've needed that to check-in for a hotel (immigration stamp). The reception staff (Mr. Hafi) also informed me that they MUST see the ORIGINAL PASSPORT of the guest because they cannot just trust to accept a scanned copy of someone's passport since anybody can manipulate a digital copy of a passport. According to him, all other hotels in the UAE that accept a digital copy of one's passport is WRONG and in violation of policy. I FELT THAT I WAS CHECKING-IN AT A POLICE STATION AND NOT IN A HOTEL. I believe it is the intent of Dubai to be a business hub of Asia and for us travelers to be able to conduct business and check-in a hotel without being judged as to digitally manipulate a copy of my passport. Please take note, I have an online reservation and have used my CREDIT CARD. I DID NOT just walk in the lobby and said please give me a room. Even if one did, I think a true HOTEL would consider SERVICE FIRST (like other hotels in the UAE) rather than letting a guest wait for 2 hours UNABLE to check-in till he gets his passport from an embassy. POOR JUDGMENT on IBIS Hotel management here in Dubai if you ask me. Get in line with the rest of the hotels in the region of the middle east and THINK OF YOUR GUEST first. YOU DO NOT WAREHOUSE PEOPLE and PASS JUDGMENT ON THEM and USE the excuse that it is DUBAI POLICE POLICY. Remember, other hotels (5 and 4 Stars) that I've stayed in Dubai do not do this. SHAME ON YOU. You are a NEW HOTEL and I think this is more of a COUNTRY MANAGEMENT ISSUE rather than IBIS Hotel in general. Like I said, I've stayed in ACCOR hotels in the middle east.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot going for this hotel except price”
Reviews.Author: Steven1969
Reviews.Content: This is the most impersonal and character-less hotel that I have stayed at. It appears to have one goal and that is to offer clean, boring and reasonably priced accommodation to travellers that want to stay in Deira. The room was basic and had no frills, even soap and toiletries were limited. The room was quite small but clever use of space meant that there was enough space to sleep, work and sit with a cup of coffee. However, the bedroom does encourage you to leave as soon as you can. Once you are outside the hotel, you are just a short walk from Deira City Mall, which has a good range of shops, restaurants and cafes. I spent most of my time here rather than eating or drinking in the hotel. It is extremely unlikely that I would come here again unless I am in financial difficultly and even then, I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Exploring”
Reviews.Author: northerncharm81
Reviews.Content: What you see is what you get with an Ibis, this hotel is the perfect base for exploring Dubai. Cheap, clean, decent sized rooms with everything you need. I stayed here for 3 nights as the first stop on my travels. Hotel is located right opposite the Deira City Centre Mall and just round the corner from the metro stop which is great for getting around. The buffet breakfast was well stocked and available 6-12pm. The hotel ran a daily free shuttle bus to the beach which was perfect for relaxing or as a starting point for exploring. All in all I would recommend this hotel, I had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, simple”
Reviews.Author: RippinKitten
Reviews.Content: i originally wanted to book in the nearby novotel deira, but since it was fully booked for the 3 days we planned, this ibis was a pleasant replacement. Pros: rooms were clean, toilet/shower (no bath tub!) also clean, bed was comfy, located near deira city centre cons: no extras (toothbrushes toothpaste etc), no fridge in the room, food was overpriced, coffee at the lobby was horrifying, staff was not able to give you their full attention since the hotel seems to always have 9 people checking in at the same time, all the time. but none of that really bothered me. what did annoy me was the fact that i could hear nearly everything going on out in the hallway from inside the room (and vice versa). conclusion: Great place to stay if you're easily pleased. Room has most of what you need, and its near a great shopping centre. I would not recommend it for a romantic weekend. More like business stop over. Or shopping trip. enjoy! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and shiny in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BadgerCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally accross the street from the City Center mall. Dubai is all about malls and this one is as good as any. It is also a great spot to catch the Dubai Big Bus tour which showed us all we wanted to see of the place. The rooms are small but spotless with good beds and nice showers. Do arrange airport shuttles with the hotel in advance as they don't seem to run at fixed times. We didn't realise this on arrival but a taxi from the airport took a few minutes and cost about 20UAD. The shuttle back was free and as quick.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Adedi
Reviews.Content: Ade - Lagos, Nigeria. Spent three days at the hotel over the christmas holidays en route to London.Arrived the hotel at 1am on board an Emirates flight from Lagos, Nigeria.Checking in took just a few minutes as i had already made an online advance booking. I had read a couple of reviews about the hotel prior to my visit and my expectations on arrival were kind of mixed, though i must acknowledge that the contents of some of the reviewa are acutally true. Hotel is pretty decent and good value for money considering its location (at the heart of Diera) and the prices of other hotels nearby. Very basic and clean rooms. The bathroom and toilet is pretty decent and i kept wondering what the fuss was on the reviews i had earlier read about the toilets and bathroom. Overall good value for money and would definitely stay there again. I however found the prices of the food at the restaurant very expensive, sandwiches (18dhs) , small bottled water (8dhs), internet (wow 25dhs!!). Tips, there is a food court at the diera shopping mall, directly opposite the hotel, so you can always dash across for your meals (from 8dhs) to getting bottled water from carrefour (3 dhs). There is an internet cafe, just three buildings before Ibis (next to the old diera shopping centre), where you can browse for an hour for 7DHS.the cafe also has a small restaurant and bottled water also sells for 3dhs. Overall, would stay there again but i believe the hotel can improve on its customer service, most especially on the attitude of the staff at the reception. I would also recommend that the rooms should be fitted with electric kettles at the very least (if fitting the rooms with fridges may have an impact on the room rates). I however found Dubai very expensive especially on fashion clothings and essentials, taxi fares, groceries etc.I would still rather do my shopping in the United Kingdom where i am sure to get good bargains without any compromise on quality. It is however a good family spot for vacations.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly 2*”
Reviews.Author: EffieCyprus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a 4* hotels and were very surprised to eventually find out that it was actually 2*. Nevertheless, it did not disappoint us at all, as it is very new, with beautiful interior design, generous breakfast, comfy rooms, clean, opposite Deira shopping mall and the metro station. Of course it was all the necessary stuff. Do not expect anything extra and special. Biggest Drawback: No free internet!

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: vonz30
Reviews.Content: we arrived early in the morning after our flight in from NZ. Met with an asian lady who wasn't particularly helpful and corrected me on the way I said dirhams lol.. The other staff were really nice, they have good hotel internet services, the breakfast buffett was awesome. The rooms were small but considering it was only one night that was fine, all i cared about was adequate air-conditioning which there was so that's fine and it was clean too. I don't know, I just felt like the front counter made you feel like you were annoying them by checking in there lol.. like I said above, it was okay for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: akatherina
Reviews.Content: We came to the Ibis because we wanted somewhere cheap and handy to the metro line. It certainly fulfilled those requirements while offering a simple, but modern and comfortable, place to stay. Although simple things were missing such as a fridge, safe or alarm clock, the shower was great, and bed was comfy. It was also very handy being so near the shopping mall. One tip if you're staying here is to bring some drinking water. None is provided and for a 1.5L bottle in the foyer it costs 10 times what it costs in the super market.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mum_and_Daughter_9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived at 7am on a Friday morning for a 'weekend break' in Dubai. The hotel is only a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport and, although we were too early to check-in, the staff were extremely helpful. We changed from warm English clothing into lighter wear, left our luggage in the safe keeping of the staff at the Ibis, and hit the town! When we returned at mid-day to check in we found the staff extremely helpful, welcoming and polite. Our twin bedded room (with shower room) was excellent, clean and comfortable . Although there were no tea/coffee making facilities this was not a problem at all. We had breakfast the following morning sat on the patio! The food was plentiful and good, well worth 55 dhr, and this set us up for the next few hours of shopping and sightseeing. The hotel is situated directly across the road from a great shopping mall, complete with Carrefour supermarket, and just a few minutes walk from the new metro station. We used the metro to get to the Mall of the Emirates and back again. Taxi fares to the gold and spice souks were about 10 drms (£2 or less), and to ride across the creek in an abra (a great experience) was 1 drm (20p). It was interesting to talk to people and find out about the boats etc on the creek - everyone was so friendly and helpful. The Hotel Ibis was a great choice and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. The locality was perfect for getting to everywhere we wanted to go - we would definitely stay again and use it as a base for our time in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wyriver
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel because of transfer to and from airport - they got rid of this service without informing the arriving guests price quoted on the internet/website - arrive there and you will pay more! their advantage is the convenient location arrogant people at reception (night manager)

Reviews.Title: “WILL STAY THERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: SWELLENDAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for 5 nights (married couple) and i will do it again in the future.Location is perfect,rooms is clean and staff is very nice.This Hotel is a bargain comparing with other Hotels.It is still very new ,the morning buffet breakfast is ok and is all one needs.If i can make a recommendation it will be to place coffee/tea making facilities in the room.Taxis is available 24 hours and the nearest metro station is only 150m away.Just accross the street is the Deira City Cente Shopping Mall. HEIN FROM SOUTH AFRICA

Reviews.Title: “Simply the place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: Me and my ten year old son decided to go for a short trip around the Emirates. Arriving late in the evening on Qatar from Frankfurt and Doha I´ve looked for a place to stay close to the airport and not that expensive. The Ibis fullfilled our needs perfectly. Not more than ten minutes by cab from Terminal 1. Only a very short wait during check-in. The guy there was real friendly and offered us immediatelly after we asked for a room on the eight floor. The room was not that large but spacious enough with two separate beds. No airport noise, but it was possible to follow the planes from the window. Shower only in the bathroom but clean at all and no noise from the rooms beside. Breakfast was also not expensive, buffet style, everything there what we need and also real good to eat outdoor in the warm morning wind. Nearly no time to wait during check-out and no problem to store our bags there. Another plus is the location only some meters around the corner from the entrance to the new and real recommendable new Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money without the standard room provisions”
Reviews.Author: lovedubaiUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this because it was brand new, right oppossite my favourite mall and very cheap. I found the room a bit small, but since just me and my best friend were going to share, that was not a problem. However the wardrobe is designed without a door, and there are no drawers in the room at all. we searched high and low! you dont get a mini bar, you dont get a hairdryer for your room, you dont get a iron or ironing board. the hairdryer i had to beg the staff for and they told me they were all being used, only when i shouted at the manager, was i provided with a new one which i then hid in my suitcase and only returned it when i left. iron and irnoning board we had to request from the porter each time we needed it, in the bathroom we only had two towels which was a bit of a nightmare - one bath size and one hand towel. and the bathroom toiletrrie, well it was all in one, hand wash body wash shampoo conditioner, all in one bottle. I am used to having all the above as i only ever stay at 4 or 5 star hotels, but since i travel so oftent o dubai, i settled for ibis. Oh, and there is no room service for food and drinks,so if you need a cup of tea, you must carry it to your room yourself, as there are no tea making facilities in the room either! despite the lack of all BASIC ROOM PROVISIONS, i would stay here again, as its very clean, the staff is very nice and its cheap for people who want to be out shopping all day . bit of a shame though , wish ibis would provide all the basics. the next door accor hotel has all of the above and actually is not much dearer.

Reviews.Title: “NICE ENOUGH”
Reviews.Author: Wrant
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS -- Cheap for Dubai, clean, helpful staff, near the metro/bus routes, near a mall, cheap food nearby. BAD POINTS, Poor breakfast choice, not a great location for sightseers, not suitable for anyone wanting to walk anywhere, small rooms. DETAILS My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, it was one of the cheaper hotels but was acceptable for our needs. It is just 5 mins taxi ride from the airport and just across the road from a mall. Food and drink is expensive in UAE but the mall has a food hall with some great choices at good prices,try the freshly cooked Italian food outlet. I was not taken with Dubai and although I would recommend this hotel, I would not recommend staying in Dubai. It is just one large building site and unless you want to spend a lot of money there is not a lot to do. Shopping prices are the same as in the UK. The Metro is very good and cheap but has a limited coverage I would recommend getting a silver pass that allows you bus and metro travel combined, just keep topping it up as you need to. You can only pay at the metro or bus stations if you do not have a pass you can not jump on a bus and pay cash. When you get on the bus you swipe you card make sure that when you get off you swipe it again (ensure that it registers) or you will get a maximum fare deducted.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Emissary
Reviews.Content: Excellent price (Dhs 295). Great location (directly opposite Deira City Centre Mall and just down the road from the new metro). Check-in was quick. Room was fine. Internet connection worked (Dhs 60 for 3 hours). Only disappointment was breakfast (Dhs 55) - not a massive choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great service”
Reviews.Author: CatWomanLeeds
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's first trip to Dubai and didn't really know what to expect! I had read all of the previous Ibis reviews before our trip and was I was not disappointed. The reason for our trip was 'shopping, shopping, shopping' (well my reason anyway!) and the hotel is just across the road from one of the best shopping malls in Dubai (in my opinion) The check-in service was quick as we were the only people checking in! it was about 1am in the morning. All of the staff that we spoke to during our 4 night stay were kind, friendly and very helpful. There is also a free shuttle bus to the beach which you need to pre-book at reception, the times are leaving the hotel at 9am or 12pm and coming back at 3pm or 5pm. The beach charges 5dhs per person to get in. I could not really fault the hotel, our room was big enough for two people, always clean, the bathroom although compact was no problem at all. The shopping mall was just outside my window too! just a little word of warning, when you get into the lifts make sure you put your room card in the slot then take out when you see the green light press the required floor otherwise the lift will not move! this was not explained to us at the reception desk but found out by getting stuck in the lift. Overall a great hotel, nothing like the Ibis hotels we get in the UK, I would recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Budget Hotels in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: khalid606
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel (Opened November 2008), so it’s clean and shining. The location is great, just across the street of Deira City Center (one of the major malls in Dubai), and it’s just 5 minutes drive to Dubai airport. The rooms are tiny, good for two people only. Advantages: - Good if you are looking for place to sleep only - Free car parking is available Disadvantages: - Internet is not free - There is no refrigerator in the room!! - No safe box in the room - No tea/coffe making tray

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizarazu20
Reviews.Content: Room: Very basic, but clean room. Had everything you’d expect but a safe. Standard basic, no frills room. Rating: (3.5/5) Staff: The staff was hit or miss. Some were great and very knowledgeable, whilst others had no idea about the simplest things (like what time the shuttle departed for the airport, and didn’t know how to find out) Rating: (3.5/5) Location: Only minutes from the airport, with the free shuttle. Literally across the street from the City Centre Mall (landmarks come in handy if you have a taxi driver that’s only been on the job for a day) Only about a 15-minute taxi ride anywhere. Downside, if you want to lounge by the pool there isn’t one, but you can pay a small fee (never inquired about the price) and go over to the Novotel, which is in the same complex only a minute away. Rating (4/5)

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic at the Ibis Deira City Centre - dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: Georgeenz
Reviews.Content: I suppose you get what you pay for. Its basic, clean and well serviced. However, its a long way from the hub of the city. Easy to get a taxi downtown but taxis didnt want to go back there. Took an hour to get a taxi to take me back. The hotel staff knew of this problem but didnt tell me. Only a few steps across to the mall... great supermarket! Good shopping over there. You have to pay to use the pool and gym equipment, which I thought was a rip-off. Staff got snitchy when I wanted my pre-paid breakfast at 4am (I only wanted tea and toast as no tea makiing faciities in the room).kids were running up and down the corridor at 1.30amI complained that kids were running up and down the corridor at 1.30am, the staff just laughed and said that it happened all the time and they couldnt do anything about it. Very basic hotel, nothing flash at all. Ok if youre out all day. ps. you cant get a meal in the restaurant on a Friday night as its closed.. so either go without or get something over at the. mall. The little cafe in the lobby is very expensive

Reviews.Title: “IBIS is good only for Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: INDIAOUTSOURCES
Reviews.Content: Hi I have stayed during my visit to GESS at Airport Expo in the month of March , probably cooler in Dubai . Dubai as said is an expensive city , and to find a Hotel at USD 100 was understandable . But this Hotel is a TWO STAR Hotel in terms of service or you can say No frill hotel . You just need to go to sleep at the end of the day and its for the same . There is no entertainment in Room , TV Reception poor , Small Room and Very Small Bathroom , No Toiletries , nothing just one bath gel . You need to pick your luggage from the Pick up Bus. For me I was fortunate to find an Indian Guy who was actually a security but helped me . IBIS is near to Novotel ,and is interconnected . Its Clean and No doubt about that , you can straight away go to City Centre which is walking distance from Hotel . Taxis are no easy available , and Hotel do not help on this. The only way is take a Hotel Cab which is going to cost atleast 30 Dhms and further if you get a Taxi its good . Its near to Airport around 20 Min , but Pick up faciltiy is too bad , I mean they have a shuttle and if you miss one then its not necesary the next will be half an hour only for me it took one hour from Airport to Hotel ( waiting for the shuttle) But the Guy was good so he helped me finding something to eat etc . IBIS has nothing to offer you , Absolutely Nothing , Even Bar has nothing to eat, except beer and Break fast has no good menu . All the while it has been mixed kind for me . But if you are looking for Cost Effective , neat and safe place , Go for it . But do not go if you want to have a Good Services etc . Final Point the Card for Entering in the room has wrongly printed you need to use the opposite side of the Arrow ( They would tell you this any ways) Thanks Rohit

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Deira City Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 8th Street, Port Saeed District | opp Deira Mall City Centre, Dubai 185310, United Arab Emirates
